definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The sutra also lists 250 examples to describe aptly the qualities of bodhichitta.
sentences.chinese: 并以250种比喻恰如其分地描述了菩提心的功德。

sentences.english: Blue bath rooms are appropriately watery.
sentences.chinese: 蓝色的卫生间与水相衬恰如其分。

sentences.english: he could not be expected to appraise properly the spirit of America.
sentences.chinese: 大家对他能否恰如其分地把握美国精魂不抱什么期望。

sentences.english: Once you have been using the right words will be eye-catching.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你能恰如其分地应用这些词汇，将会引人注目的。

sentences.english: Appropriately enough, Chambers' conviction has spurred a flurry of tweets ridiculing the decision.
sentences.chinese: 恰如其分地，钱伯斯的信念促使了嘲笑决定鸣叫乱舞。

sentences.english: His jaw tightened, but he kept his smile in place with some effort.
sentences.chinese: 他下巴一紧，但还是努力保持着恰如其分的微笑。

sentences.english: The financial markets are appropriately cynical about U.S. politics.
sentences.chinese: 金融市场恰如其分地对美国的政治冷嘲热讽。

sentences.english: Jazz has been called America's classical music, and for good reason.
sentences.chinese: 爵士乐被称作为美国的经典音乐，是恰如其分的。

sentences.english: If handled well, there is a sense of the United States appropriately defects.
sentences.chinese: 处理得好，令人有恰如其分缺陷美之感。

sentences.english: Many Chinese proverbs cannot be properly rendered into English.
sentences.chinese: 许多中国谚语都不能恰如其分地译成英语。

sentences.english: They react to how they are treated and always respond appropriately.
sentences.chinese: 它们总能恰如其分的对别人对自己的行为作出回应。

sentences.english: Guomu conference table gives you a proper sence of comfort and shows its full function.
sentences.chinese: 国木会议桌为您营造出恰如其分的感觉和功能。

sentences.english: I don't know whether that's true or not, but it may very well be.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道这一说法是否真实，但是它很可能恰如其分。

sentences.english: When this mind is master of itself, all the actions of our daily life will be perfectly appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 这念心能够作主，日常生活所作所为，就能恰如其分。

definition: lit. extreme saturation (idiom)/fig. vividly and thoroughly/in great detail/without restraint/(of a performance) brilliant
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥貼|妥贴[tuo3 tie1]
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
